evidence.location: Page 1, Filed date and judgment text

evidence.text: the Court enjoins Defendant from enforcing City Ordinances against the plaintiff class as follows: ... c. Defendant is enjoined from enforcing GPMC 5.61.030, GPMC 6.46.090 (the camping ordinances) and GPMC 5.57.020(A) (criminal trespassing on city property related to parks) from 9:00 p.m. to 7:30 a.m. during the months of April through September and from 7:00 p.m. to 7:30 a.m. during the months of October to March, in all City parks with the exception of Reinhart Volunteer Park

extracted.value: 08/26/20: Permanent injunction enjoining enforcement of GPMC 5.61.030, 6.46.090, and 5.57.020(A) from specified hours in parks (except Reinhart Volunteer Park)

evidence.text: the district court permanently enjoined enforcement of the anti-camping ordinances during daytime hours unless an initial warning was given 'at least 24 hours before enforcement.'

extracted.value: Permanent: Enforcement of anti-camping ordinances at night in all City parks (except one) and during daytime hours with 24-hour warning

evidence.text: the district court permanently enjoined enforcement of the anti-camping ordinances, as well as an ordinance regarding 'criminal trespassing on city property related to parks,' in all City parks at night except for one park where the parties agreed the injunction need not apply.

extracted.value: Enforcement of anti-camping ordinances in all City parks at night except for one park where the parties agreed the injunction need not apply

evidence.text: the district court also permanently enjoined enforcement of the anti-camping ordinances during daytime hours unless an initial warning was given 'at least 24 hours before enforcement.'

extracted.value: Enforcement of anti-camping ordinances during daytime hours unless an initial warning was given 'at least 24 hours before enforcement'
